author: tgannon
title: Liverpool target Mario Gotze ruled out indefinitely with ‘metabolic disturbances’
text:
Comments MARIO GOTZE has been ruled out indefinitely with “metabolic disturbances”. 
The Liverpool target has been withdrawn from Borussia Dortmund training after suffering from muscular problems in the last few months. Action Images 1 Mario Gotze has been ruled out indefinitely with ‘metabolic disturbances’ 
Scans revealed the Germany World Cup winner has ‘metabolic disturbances’– an illness which develops when the body cannot properly process fats, proteins, sugars or nucleic acids. 
Keep up to date with ALL the football news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Germany World Cup winner Gotze, 24, said: “I’m currently undergoing treatment and will do everything in my power to be back in training and helping my team to achieve our common goals as soon as possible.” 
Dortmund’s sporting director, Michael Zorc, added: “We’re happy to have now uncovered the reasons for Mario’s difficulties and are convinced that his extraordinary abilities will give us additional quality once he has completely recovered from this. “Mario has the full backing and maximum support of everyone at BVB during his recovery!” 
Gotze has made 16 appearances and scored twice for Dortmund since returning from a three-year stint at Bayern Munich. 
The midfielder signed for Bayern in a £31.5million deal in 2013. 
Dortmund paid £22m to resign their former talisman. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang returns to Dortmund after the Africa Cup of Nations
